containerDetails.title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?

keyPoints.title: We are living longer than ever before.

data.title: How Science Has Made It Possible for Humans to Live Longer, 2017
Breaking the Ceiling of Human Maximal Life span, 2018

keyPoints.title: We also spend a larger and larger portion of our lives being sick.

data.title: Does time spent in hospital in the final 15 years of life increase with age at death? A population based study, 1999

keyPoints.title: Scientists are trying to shift the attention from optimizing lifespans to optimizing health spans.

data.title: Lifespan and Healthspan: Past, Present, and Promise, 2015
What's more important than your life span? Your health span, 2013

keyPoints.title: The science of aging has made enormous progress in the last few years.

data.title: Ending Aging: The Rejuvenation Breakthroughs That Could Reverse Human Aging in Our Lifetime, 2007
Mitochondria: Central Organelles for Melatonin′s Antioxidant and Anti-Aging Actions, 2018
The Search for Antiaging Interventions: From Elixirs to Fasting Regimens, 2014

keyPoints.title: Each time one of your cells divides, it copies its chromosomes.

data.title: The Cell Cycle, Mitosis and Meiosis, retrieved 2019

keyPoints.title: We have long segments of DNA called telomeres.

data.title: Telomere, 2018
Nobel Lecture by Elizabeth H. Blackburn, 2009

keyPoints.title: The telomeres are gone and the cell becomes a zombie. A senescent cell.

data.title: 15 - Cellular Senescence, 2015
The role of senescent cells in ageing, 2014
The role of senescent cells in ageing, 2014

keyPoints.title: They are linked to many diseases like diabetes and kidney failure.

data.title: Cellular senescence links aging and diabetes in cardiovascular disease, 2018
Cellular senescence in the aging and diseased kidney, 2018

keyPoints.title: Genetically engineered mice could destroy their senescent cells as they pleased.

data.title: Destroying worn-out cells makes mice live longer, 2016
Naturally occurring p16Ink4a-positive cells shorten healthy lifespan, 2016

keyPoints.title: Overall they lived up to 30% longer and in better health than average mice.

data.title: Destroying worn-out cells makes mice live longer, 2016
Naturally occurring p16Ink4a-positive cells shorten healthy lifespan, 2016

keyPoints.title: Most cells in the body commit cell suicide when they are damaged. Senescent cells don’t.

data.title: Tricking a Cancer Cell into Committing Suicide or Apoptosis, 2017
Senescence and apoptosis: dueling or complementary cell fates?, 2014

keyPoints.title: It turns out that they underproduce a protein that tells them when it’s time to die.

data.title: Debilities of Aging Reversed by Protein That Targets Senescent Cells, 2017

keyPoints.title: Mice were given an injection of this protein it killed 80% of all their senescent cells.

data.title: Aging of mice is associated with p16(Ink4a)- and β-galactosidase-positive macrophage accumulation that can be induced in young mice by senescent cells, 2016
The Science of SENSOlytics™, retrieved 2019

keyPoints.title: As a result, there are a number of new companies looking at treatments involving senescent cells.

data.title: The Science of SENSOlytics™, retrieved 2019
Siwa Therapeutics, retrieved 2019

keyPoints.title: Cells constantly need to be destroyed, cleaned up and rebuilt.

data.title: Tissue repair: The hidden drama, 2010

keyPoints.title: One of these parts is NAD+, a coenzyme that tells our cells to look after themselves.

data.title: Emerging therapeutic roles for NAD+ metabolism in mitochondrial and age-related disorders, 2016

keyPoints.title: At age 50 we only have about half as much in our bodies as we do at age 20.

data.title: Anti-Aging Mechanisms of NAD+, 2018
Why NAD+ Declines during Aging: It’s Destroyed, 2016

keyPoints.title: Low amounts of it are linked to a whole bunch of diseases.

data.title: NAD + biosynthesis, aging, and disease, 2018
Role of NAD+ and mitochondrial sirtuins in cardiac and renal diseases, 2017
The Importance of NAD in Multiple Sclerosis, 2009
The Importance of NAD in Multiple Sclerosis, 2009

keyPoints.title: But NAD+ can’t enter cells, so we can’t get it as a pill.

data.title: NAD+ Metabolism and the Control of Energy Homeostasis: A Balancing Act between Mitochondria and the Nucleus, 2015

keyPoints.title: Scientists noticed that more flexible substances could enter cells and turn into NAD+ inside.

data.title: NRK1 controls nicotinamide mononucleotide and nicotinamide riboside metabolism in mammalian cells, 2016

keyPoints.title: In 2016 multiple trials on mice showed that they boosted the multiplication of stem cells.

data.title: NAD+ repletion improves mitochondrial and stem cell function and enhances life span in mice, 2016

keyPoints.title: This even got NASA interested.

data.title: NASA to Test Fountain of Youth on Astronauts in Six Months, 2017

keyPoints.title: There are human trials being planned right now.

data.title: Chronic nicotinamide riboside supplementation is well-tolerated and elevates NAD+ in healthy middle-aged and older adults, 2018

keyPoints.title: Stem cells are like cell blueprints that sit at various places in the body.

data.title: What are stem cells, and what do they do?, 2018

keyPoints.title: But they decline as we age and so we decline too.

data.title: Effect of aging on stem cells, 2017

keyPoints.title: Stem cells from baby mice brains were injected into the brains of middle aged mice.

data.title: Brain’s stem cells slow ageing in mice, 2017
Hypothalamic stem cells control ageing speed partly through exosomal miRNAs, 2017

keyPoints.title: Stem cells from mice embryos were injected directly into the hearts of older mice.

data.title: Cardiac and systemic rejuvenation after cardiosphere-derived cell therapy in senescent rats, 2017

keyPoints.title: With very old age, the probability of dying may not rise anymore.

data.title: Once you hit this age, aging appears to stop, 2018

keyPoints.title: Ageism: Stereotyping someone based on their age.

data.title: Ageism, 2019
